section.title: Adding a Red Hat Satellite Instance for Host Provisioning
section.para: Add a Satellite instance for host provisioning to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager. Red Hat Virtualization 4.0 is supported with Red Hat Satellite 6.1.

procedure.title: Adding a Satellite Instance for Host Provisioning

step.para: Select the External Providers entry in the tree pane.
Click Add to open the Add Provider window.
From the Type list, ensure that Foreman/Satellite is selected.
Enter the URL or fully qualified domain name of the machine on which the Satellite instance is installed in the Provider URL text field. You do not need to specify a port number.

important.para: IP addresses cannot be used to add a Satellite instance.

step.para: Enter the Username and Password for the Satellite instance. You must use the same user name and password as you would use to log in to the Satellite provisioning portal.
Click Test to test whether you can authenticate successfully with the Satellite instance using the provided credentials.
If the Satellite instance uses SSL, the Import provider certificates window opens; click OK to import the certificate that the Satellite instance provides.

important.para: You must import the certificate that the Satellite instance provides to ensure the Manager can communicate with the instance.

section.para: You have added the Satellite instance to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager, and can work with the hosts it provides.
